sn52.10:1.1: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Dark Forest. And he was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
sn52.10:1.2: Then several mendicants went up to Venerable Anuruddha, and said to him:
sn52.10:2.1: “What meditation does Venerable Anuruddha practice so that physical pain doesn’t occupy his mind?”
sn52.10:2.2: “Reverends, I meditate with my mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation so that physical pain doesn’t occupy my mind.
sn52.10:2.4: I meditate observing an aspect of the body …
sn52.10:2.7: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.10:2.8: I meditate with my mind firmly established in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation so that physical pain doesn’t occupy my mind.”
